titleStmt.title: To W. B. Tegetmeier [28 March – 14 April 1861]

availability.licence: DCP-LETT-3103F by The Darwin Correspondence Project is licensed under a Attribution-NonCommercial 4.0 International (CC BY-NC 4.0). Based on a work at https://www.darwinproject.ac.uk/letter/?docId=letters/DCP-LETT-3103F.xml.

sourceDesc.bibl: R & R Enterprises Autograph Auctions, Nov 2006

abstract.p: Asks for some unspecified items to be sent to him. The Half-lop [rabbit] should be killed, but without damaging the skull. Has not opened the box with skulls yet.

div.p: send them to me by enclosed address. as I rather want to see two of them.—
My dear Sir | yours sincerely | C. Darwin
I am getting together a few points to investigate.—
I think the Half-lop, had better be killed (not knocked on Head) if you get one.—
I have not yet opened the Box with the Skulls; for I have not yet come to Skeleton.—

div.note: The date range is established by the relationship between this letter and the letters to W. B. Tegetmeier, 28 March [1861] and 14 April [1861] (Correspondence vol. 9).

CD was interested in how the skulls of domestic rabbits were modified by the lengthening and lopping of their ears; the half-lop rabbit has one ear lopping forward, and a correspondingly asymmetrical skull (see Variation 2: 324–5).
Tegetmeier had lent CD his collection of fowl skulls for his work on Variation (see Variation 1: 260, and Correspondence vol. 9, letter to W. B. Tegetmeier, 28 March [1861]).
The letter advertised by the dealer is incomplete; all the available text is transcribed above.
